author: Special Correspondent
text:
Former Union Minister M.K. Alagiri on Wednesday sought police action against people who, he said, had been spreading malicious statements in his name through social media.

In a complaint addressed to Commissioner of Police Shailesh Kumar Yadav, Mr. Alagiri said that though he did not have any account in Facebook and Twitter, there had been some comments in both the social media in his name describing the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam as “a rotten fruit”. He said that he was shocked to know about this when it was brought to his notice by some of the private television channel reporters who sought his clarification on the issue. He said that some people had been making such comments in the social media in his name due to political rivalry and to ruin his name. He wanted the police to initiate appropriate action against those indulging in such criminal action.

A group of lawyers handed over the complaint on behalf of Mr. Alagiri, to Deputy Commissioner of Police (Law and Order) Bandi Gangadhar.
title: Alagiri lodges police complaint
